results.name: Triangle by columns: (1, 2, 0, 0, 0, ...) in every column.
comment: Binomial transform of the triangle = A110813.
Inverse = a triangle with (1, -2, 4, -8, 16, ...) in every column.
Triangle T(n,k), 0 <= k <= n, given by [2,-2,0,0,0,0,0,0,...] DELTA [1,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,...] where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938. - _Philippe Deléham_, Feb 08 2009
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) = 1 if n=k, 2 if k = n-1, 0 otherwise.
example: First few rows of the triangle:
maple: seq(seq(T(n,k), k=1..n), n = 1..15); # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 20 2019
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==n, 1, if(k==n-1, 2, 0)); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 20 2019
(MAGMA) T:= func< n,k | k eq n select 1 else k eq n-1 select 2 else 0 >;
[T(n,k): k in [1..n], n in [1..15]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 20 2019
[[T(n,k) for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..15)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 20 2019
Flat(List([1..15], n-> List([1..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 20 2019
